citations.narrative:
The facility does not have a current inventory of animals on hand, including records of births and deaths. The facility has
moved out a large number of animals and although disposition records are available for review, the overall inventory of
animals on hand has not been updated. Additionally, there is no record on a muntjac born a few weeks ago that went
missing the following day. Accurate records of animals on hand, including acquisitions and dispositions (including births
and deaths) are necessary to assess the health and wellbeing of the animals on site and allow tracking of animals being
used for regulatory purposes. Correct by 10 April 2024 by ensuring the inventory of all animals on hand is up to date and
all acquisitions and dispositions are being recorded including animals born on site or any deaths.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
The facility does not have a developed and documented environmental enhancement plan for the birds at the facility.
Failure to develop and document an environmental enhancement program for birds can negatively impact their health and
well-being, causing unnecessary psychological distress. Correct by 12 April 2024 by developing, documenting, and
following a species-appropriate plan for environmental enhancement that is adequate to promote the psychological well-
being of the birds. The plan must be approved by the attending veterinarian and must be in accordance with the
regulations in subpart G and with currently accepted professional standards as cited in appropriate professional journals
and reference guides. This plan must be made available to APHIS upon request. The plan must address each category
listed in 3.154.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
Additional Inspectors:
CHRISTINA RADZAI, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
